basic.floral_language:
Portulacaria afra
Floriography: wealthy, vigorous, delicate
Has an elegant plant form, fleshy thin leaves in nearly a heart shape, fresh green, with abundant sunlight, stems turn purple red and leaves are more rigid, grows fast and can be trimmed frequently for different shapes. 
Likes abundant sunlight, does not have an apparent dormant period. Flowers sometimes, pink to red color.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, pale pink to red flowers
basic.color: Leaf color green, when sunny stems turning to purple

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, no apparent period of dormancy
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
